channel.title: BBC News
channel.description: The latest stories from the Technology section of the BBC News web site.
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: VIDEO: A week through Google Glass
item.description: The BBC's Technology Correspondent Rory Cellan-Jones tried out Google Glass for a week, documenting his work and home life.

item.title: VIDEO: Video gamers storm London Book Fair
item.description: Video game designers storm the London Book Fair

item.title: VIDEO: A look inside a 'Cybersquat'
item.description: BBC Click's Jen Copestake spent a week in one of the most renowned squats in Barcelona, following the developers of Bitcoin tools and other open source software.

item.title: VIDEO: Tech review: This week's headlines
item.description: A two-way mirror aims to take the perfect selfie, plus other tech news.

item.title: VIDEO: First look at the Samsung S5
item.description: Rory Cellan-Jones tries out Samsung's latest S5 phone, as it makes its global launch on Friday.

item.title: VIDEO: The app which aims to solve dilemmas
item.description: Click's Kate Russell reviews websites and apps including one which helps break down tough decisions.

item.title: AUDIO: Why are tech stocks sliding?
item.description: Eileen Burbidge of Passion Capital and Alpesh Patel from Praefinium Partners analyse why there is a downturn in tech stocks.

item.title: VIDEO: Minesweeper robot winning exports
item.description: A Cambridgeshire firm has designed a robot minesweeper that is winning exports to Africa and South America.

item.title: VIDEO: Hi-tech goggles 'detect cancer cells'
item.description: A US trial of hi-tech goggles could reduce the need for secondary operations for cancer patients.

item.title: VIDEO: How to avoid password meltdown
item.description: Rory Cellan-Jones looks at some of the ways people can manage multiple passwords online, to increase security.

item.title: VIDEO: Public urged to reset passwords
item.description: Several technology firms urge users to change all their passwords after what has been called a "catastrophic flaw" in security software.

item.title: VIDEO: Charge your smartphone in 30 secs
item.description: New technology means you could charge your empty mobile phone battery in 30 seconds.

item.title: VIDEO: Global solar-powered plane unveiled
item.description: Andre Borschberg, one of two pilots who will attempt to circumnavigate the globe in the solar-powered plane Solar Impulse 2, gives a guided tour of the new craft.

item.title: AUDIO: Samsung forecasts drop in profits
item.description: Kantar WorldPanel ComTech's strategic director Dominic Sunnebo discusses Samsung's forecasted drop in profits.

item.title: VIDEO: US investors bet on news start-ups
item.description: The financial future of the news business is uncertain, but lately US venture capitalists have been placing their bets on journalism.

item.title: VIDEO: The tech that could change TV adverts
item.description: As more people choose to watch content online, Marc Cieslak finds out what is the future might hold for TV advertising.

item.title: VIDEO: India election: The counting machine
item.description: Shilpa Kannan looks at how the 1.4 million electronic vote-counting machines, made in Hyderabad and Bangalore, actually work.

item.title: VIDEO: Aliens and monsters 'invade' bus stop
item.description: LJ Rich reports on an advertising campaign that uses a camera and special effects to entertain commuters.

item.title: VIDEO: Why is it hard to build a kangaroo?
item.description: A German technology firm have developed a digital marsupial, a robotic kangaroo that can leap and land with precision.

item.title: VIDEO: US gamers play skyscraper Tetris
item.description: Fans of the classic video game Tetris have helped mark its 30th anniversary by bringing the game to new heights.

item.title: VIDEO: Assange's support for European internet
item.description: In a rare interview, Julian Assange - founder the whistle-blowing website Wikileaks - speaks to the BBC's technology programme Click.

item.title: VIDEO: Mozilla boss quits following gay row
item.description: The chief executive of Mozilla, who had been heavily criticised for supporting a ban on same-sex marriage, has stepped down.

item.title: VIDEO: Revenge porn victim: I trusted him
item.description: Anisha explains how having explicit pictures of her online has affected her life.

item.title: VIDEO: Amazon Fire TV 'a great experience'
item.description: Dave Limp, vice president of devices at Amazon, told the BBC that operating the device was a "great experience" for the user.

item.title: VIDEO: Microsoft launches answer to Siri
item.description: Microsoft showcases a new virtual assistant as part of an upcoming update for Windows phones.

item.title: VIDEO: 'Like Robocop without the weaponry'
item.description: The BBC's Richard Taylor checks out a hi-tech robot security guard.

item.title: VIDEO: Unlocking the mysteries of the earth
item.description: The BBC's Nick Higham talks to James Lovelock, the author of Rough Ride to the Future, which predicts the earth's future

item.title: AUDIO: How secure is paying by mobile?
item.description: A new smartphone service will allow banking customers to pay recipients using only their phone number.

item.title: VIDEO: Will UK get to vote on EU future?
item.description: Four European election candidates debate their party's stance on a referendum over the UK's future within the EU.

item.title: VIDEO: Kansas City shooting leaves three dead
item.description: At least three people have been shot dead in attacks at a Jewish community site and a retirement home in Kansas City in the US Midwest.

item.title: VIDEO: French Jews 'afraid to be Jewish'
item.description: Israel has said an increasing number of Jewish people are migrating to the country from France because of a rise in anti-Semitism.

item.title: VIDEO: Abu Hamza terror trial to start in US
item.description: The trial of Abu Hamza al-Masri, the radical cleric extradited from the UK to the US in 2012, is due to start at a federal court in New York on Monday.

item.title: VIDEO: Duke and Duchess on tour in NZ
item.description: The Duke and Duchess of Cambridge have met the families of people killed in the Christchurch earthquake of 2011.

item.title: VIDEO: Nigeria blasts kill 'dozens'
item.description: Two bombs have exploded at a crowded bus station on the outskirts of the Nigerian capital, Abuja.

item.title: VIDEO: Cleaning up Cairo's waste system
item.description: The Egyptian government is turning to its traditional rubbish collectors - the Zabaleen - to revolutionise Cario's waste disposal industry.

item.title: VIDEO: Unusual punishment for US bully
item.description: A judge in Ohio has ordered a man to appear in public, holding a sign that reads: "I am a bully" after being convicted of harassment.

item.title: VIDEO: Pope poses for selfies with crowds
item.description: More than 100,000 pilgrims flocked to St Peter's Square as Pope Francis led the traditional Palm Sunday celebrations.

item.title: VIDEO: Abdullah 'leading' in Afghan count
item.description: The first results of the Afghan presidential election which took place last Saturday are beginning to come through.

item.title: VIDEO: Green-fingered Kuwaitis' labour of love
item.description: A growing number of Kuwaitis are overcoming the country's arid desert conditions to experience the joys of gardening.

item.title: VIDEO: Thousands flee deadly fire in Chile
item.description: A forest fire in Chile has killed at least 11 people and destroyed 500 homes in the historic port city of Valparaiso.

item.title: VIDEO: India election: Middle class to act
item.description: Rampant corruption and a slowing economy could see an anxious middle class head to the polling stations.

item.title: VIDEO: Baby's murder charge dropped
item.description: A Pakistani court has withdrawn the case against a nine-month-old baby who was accused of attempted murder alongside 12 members of his family.

item.title: VIDEO: Green investment 'needs to treble'
item.description: Scientists are calling for a big shift to renewable energy as a solution to the problems caused by global warming.

item.title: VIDEO: Inside Germany's coal-mining operation
item.description: David Shukman reports on the massive scale of the German coal-mining operation.

item.title: VIDEO: The films making science captivating
item.description: David Reid travels to the Cern institute in Switzerland to find out how film-makers are helping to make science stories more accessible to the public.

item.title: VIDEO: Brazil police clash with squatters
item.description: Police and squatters have clashed in Rio de Janeiro as officials moved in to evict up to 5,000 people from a building belonging to a local telecommunications company.

item.title: VIDEO: Pistorius trial day 20 - in 60 secs
item.description: Oscar Pistorius faced another day of intense cross-examination at his trial on Friday - and said he "was in a panic" in the moments before he shot his girlfriend Reeva Steenkamp.

item.title: VIDEO: Easter Island's first music school
item.description: A music school has opened for the first time on one of the remotest islands on earth.

item.title: VIDEO: Get set, freeze! North Pole marathon run
item.description: Runners who find the considerable challenge of competing a marathon distance too easy have competed with the extra tests of sub-zero temperatures.

item.title: VIDEO: Anja Niedringhaus funeral held
item.description: Hundreds of mourners in Germany have been paying their respects to Anja Niedringhaus, the German Associated Press photographer killed in Afghanistan last week.

item.title: VIDEO: Rio robbery attempt caught on camera
item.description: A Brazilian woman has narrowly avoided being robbed - while being interviewed about local crime.

item.title: VIDEO: Crimea lions 'at risk of starvation'
item.description: The owner of a safari park in Crimea says his big cats could soon starve to death as he cannot afford to buy meat for the animals after Ukrainian banks blocked the park's accounts.

item.title: VIDEO: Footage as FBI frees kidnapped man
item.description: An FBI Hostage Rescue Team has rescued a man who was kidnapped for five days in revenge for his daughter's work as an assistant district attorney.

item.title: VIDEO: Hi-tech goggles 'detect cancer cells'
item.description: A US trial of hi-tech goggles could reduce the need for secondary operations for cancer patients.

item.title: VIDEO: Al-Jazeera trial dismissed as 'joke'
item.description: Three Al-Jazeera journalists have denounced as a "joke" the latest hearing in their trial on terrorism charges in Egypt.

item.title: VIDEO: 'Lost' seal pup charms Swedish city
item.description: A baby seal has been attracting attention in Sundsvall, Sweden, after it was spotted in the city's harbour having apparently lost its way while swimming in the Baltic Sea.

item.title: VIDEO: US condemns Russia gas warning
item.description: The United States has accused Russia of using its energy supplies "as a tool of coercion" to try to control Ukraine.

item.title: VIDEO: Below deck of Syria chemical destroyer
item.description: Time is fast running out for Syria to hand over its chemical weapons stocks, the international body in charge of their destruction says.

item.title: VIDEO: Mexican pyramid 'at risk of sinking'
item.description: A team of researchers in Mexico warns that the Pyramid of the Sun, one of the top tourist attractions of the country, could be at risk of slowly sinking into the ground.

item.title: VIDEO: Could Russia turn off the gas taps?
item.description: Russian President Vladimir Putin has warned European leaders that Ukraine's delays in paying for Russian gas have created a "critical situation".

item.title: VIDEO: Close-up: Sub ready to locate MH370
item.description: Specialists are preparing the submarine which will be used when the general location of the missing Malaysia Airlines flight MH370 plane in the Indian Ocean is identified.

item.title: VIDEO: Shoe thrown at Hillary Clinton
item.description: A woman has thrown a shoe at former First Lady Hillary Clinton as she was giving a speech in Las Vegas.

item.title: VIDEO: Is this Brazil's biggest football fan?
item.description: Meet lawyer Nelson Paviotti, a man so passionate about Brazil he only dresses in clothes sporting Brazil's national colours - and even the food he eats at home has to be green and yellow.

item.title: VIDEO: Royals continue New Zealand tour
item.description: The Duke and Duchess of Cambridge have paid their respects to New Zealand's war dead as their royal tour continues.

item.title: VIDEO: How will Muslim vote affect India polls?
item.description: The BBC's Mishal Husain reports from India's most populous state, Uttar Pradesh, on how the Muslim vote could affect the election.

item.title: VIDEO: Afghan child casualties top priority
item.description: Karen Allen looks at one of the top priorities for the new Afghan leader - to reduce growing numbers of civilian casualties, among them young children.

item.title: VIDEO: Indian elections: A family business
item.description: The BBC's Sanjoy Majumder looks at why, despite being a flourishing democracy for more than six decades, Indian politics is still very much a family business.

item.title: VIDEO: On the road with President Putin
item.description: President Putin says Ukraine will have to pay for its imports of Russian gas in advance. Daniel Sandford travels alongside the president, and watches as he holds a meeting.

item.title: AUDIO: Wrestler: Warrior was a 'superhero'
item.description: British wrestler Jimmy Havoc says he is "gutted" about the death of "superhero" The Ultimate Warrior.

item.title: VIDEO: Coal miners' thoughts on Ukraine future
item.description: The BBC's Steve Rosenberg has visited a mine in Donetsk and spoken to miners there about the future of eastern Ukraine.

item.title: VIDEO: FDLR seeks peace talks with Rwanda
item.description: The FDLR, or so-called democratic forces for the liberation of Rwanda, has laid down its weapons and is seeking to negotiate with Rwanda, the group's president says.

item.title: VIDEO: What will sway rural Indians' votes?
item.description: On the first big day of India's general election, Mishal Husain visits a rural village in Uttar Pradesh to see what matters to voters there.

item.title: VIDEO: 'My daughter was frantic'
item.description: A total of 20 students have been injured in a stabbing in a high school in the US state of Pennsylvania.

item.title: VIDEO: Homs double car bombing 'kills 25'
item.description: Two car bombs have exploded in the Syrian city of Homs, killing at least 25 people and wounding scores more, state news agency Sana says.

item.title: VIDEO: Obama's tribute to Fort Hood victims
item.description: President Barack Obama has said the US "must do more" to keep firearms out of the hands of those suffering from mental health issues.

item.title: VIDEO: Rwanda: From ministers to exiles
item.description: Some of those cleared by an international tribunal set up to try the suspected masterminds of the genocide in Rwanda, have been speaking to the BBC's Anne Soy from a safe house in Arusha.

item.title: VIDEO: Big rat boards NYC subway train
item.description: A big rat caused a commotion on a New York subway train when it managed to get itself trapped in a carriage.

item.title: VIDEO: Pistorius quizzed on Reeva evidence
item.description: South Africa's Oscar Pistorius has faced fierce questioning about his version of events on the night he shot his girlfriend Reeva Steenkamp.

item.title: VIDEO: Toyota to recall 6.4 million vehicles
item.description: Toyota is recalling 6.4 million vehicles globally, including 35,124 in the UK, over five separate issues.

item.title: VIDEO: New signals detected in MH370 search
item.description: Teams searching for the missing Malaysia Airlines plane have reacquired signals that could be consistent with "black box" flight recorders.

item.title: VIDEO: Sri Lankan cricketers welcomed home
item.description: Sri Lanka's cricketers are welcomed home by thousands of fans after winning the World Twenty20 crown.

item.title: VIDEO: New hope for Pinochet missing
item.description: Nearly 40,000 files on people who went missing during the rule of Augusto Pinochet have been released by authorities in Chile.

item.title: VIDEO: Why is Japan building up its navy?
item.description: As the balance of power in Asia swings towards China, Japan is building one of the most modern and powerful naval forces in the world.

item.title: VIDEO: WHO: Ebola outbreak 'challenging'
item.description: An outbreak of the deadly Ebola virus in West Africa is "one of the most challenging" the World Health Organisation has ever faced, the organisation says.

item.title: VIDEO: Indonesia prepares for elections
item.description: Indonesia holds parliamentary elections on Wednesday in a vote that will heavily influence who becomes the country's next president.

item.title: VIDEO: Salmond says vote 'not about SNP'
item.description: Scotland's First Minister Alex Salmond addresses his party conference with a message a vote for independence is not a vote for the SNP.

item.title: VIDEO: Parties bid for votes at EU elections
item.description: Four candidates were given 30-seconds each to spell out their party's message for the European elections on 22 May.

item.title: VIDEO: Suffragette film is shot in Parliament
item.description: The Houses of Parliament are for the first time being used as a set for a commercial film, as shooting for Suffragette takes place.

item.title: VIDEO: Miliband makes 'painful' Israel visit
item.description: Labour leader Ed Miliband says on a visit to Israel that he is a supporter of "the homeland for the Jewish people".

item.title: VIDEO: Fixed or floating election voters?
item.description: Have voters already made up their minds about the general election, or is their vote still up for grabs?

item.title: VIDEO: Tory MPs given anti-bullying code
item.description: The Conservative Party has issued a code of conduct to all its MPs telling them not to "bully, abuse or harass" staff.

item.title: VIDEO: Stewart: Evans been put through the mill
item.description: MP Bob Stewart says Nigel Evans has "been through the mill" in a court case where a jury cleared him of all charges.

item.title: VIDEO: Anti-EU parties on the rise across Europe
item.description: The eurozone crisis is expected to help the electoral fortunes of anti-EU parties in May's European elections.

item.title: VIDEO: Putting MEPs in their political armies
item.description: The European Parliament has political groupings each made up of at least 25 MEPs from across at least seven nations.

item.title: VIDEO: European week in 60 seconds
item.description: Alex Forsyth reviews the European political week in 60 seconds, with headlines from Strasbourg and Brussels.

item.title: VIDEO: Javid: 'Public right to judge Miller'
item.description: Former Culture Secretary Maria Miller "did do something wrong" and the public were right to judge her, the man who has replaced her has said.

item.title: AUDIO: MP: Financial error due to dyslexia
item.description: A Conservative MP has claimed her dyslexia was one of the reasons she failed to register £28,000 in donations.

item.title: VIDEO: Bringing Thatcher to West End stage
item.description: Two actors discuss research for their roles playing Margaret Thatcher in a play transferring to London's West End.

item.title: VIDEO: Nine MPs running in London marathon
item.description: A record number of nine MPs are due to run in the London Marathon this weekend

item.title: VIDEO: TUSC: Different argument out there
item.description: TUSC aims to "give hope to people there is a different argument out there" says former MP Dave Nellist.

item.title: AUDIO: TV politicians 'add to cynicism'
item.description: Prof Steven Fielding and House of Cards author Lord Dobbs discuss the portrayal of fictional politicians on television

item.title: VIDEO: PM on Nigel Evans case
item.description: Prime Minister David Cameron says it is hard to imagine the relief Nigel Evans must feel after 'such a traumatic time'.

item.title: VIDEO: Freaked out by too much choice?
item.description: Politicians like the word choice around when it comes to public services but are people good at making decisions?

item.title: VIDEO: Is it important to know price of milk?
item.description: David Cameron probably does now know how much the average basket of food costs, says Nadine Dorries.

item.title: VIDEO: MP 'sacked' over Miller tweet
item.description: Tory MP Michael Fabricant claims on Twitter that he has been sacked as Conservative Party vice-chairman for earlier comments about Maria Miller's resignation.

item.title: VIDEO: Books and guitars 'rehabilitate' prisoners
item.description: The musician and activist Billy Bragg on how restricting access to guitars in prison will damage his charity's work

item.title: VIDEO: PM 'disconnected with public'
item.description: The prime minister's handling of the Maria Miller expense scandal shows "how disconnected he is with public opinion", the leader of the UK Independence Party has said.

item.title: VIDEO: Basingstoke reaction to Miller
item.description: A Tory and a UKIP councillor in Basingstoke give their reaction to Maria Miller's resignation

item.title: VIDEO: MPs' expenses under the spotlight
item.description: The prime minister says MPs' expenses rules have been improved since 2010, but says there is more to do to "reassure the public".

item.title: VIDEO: Shapps: Miller was becoming the story
item.description: Maria Miller "was becoming the story" and this stopped coverage of other news, says the Tory Party chairman.

item.title: VIDEO: Nick Robinson and MPs review PMQs
item.description: The exchanges at PMQs over Maria Miller are reviewed by Grant Shapps, Chuka Umunna, Nick Robinson and Andrew Neil.

item.title: VIDEO: Anger 'very raw and needs to be acted on'
item.description: Asked about Maria Miller, David Cameron says the anger over expenses was "very raw and needs to be acted on".

item.title: VIDEO: Miller: I wish I could have stayed'
item.description: Maria Miller said she hoped she could have kept her ministerial post, but she felt she had to leave because the row over her expenses claim had detracted attention from the "government's achievements".

item.title: VIDEO: Miliband: Terrible error of judgment
item.description: Ed Miliband accuses the prime minister of a "terrible error of judgment" for his handling of Maria Miller's expenses.

item.title: AUDIO: Miller resignation 'her own decision'
item.description: Education secretary Michael Gove discusses culture secretary Maria Miller's resignation over expenses.

item.title: VIDEO: 'It should have happened days ago'
item.description: The Labour MP whose complaint sparked the investigation into Maria Miller's expenses says her resignation should have happened "days ago."

item.title: VIDEO: When politicians are sorry, so so sorry
item.description: Nick Clegg, Rob Ford, Liam Fox, Jacqui Smith, Andrew Mitchell, Ron Davies, Nadine Dorries and Bill Clinton say sorry.

item.title: AUDIO: Forces widow calls for pension change
item.description: Campaigners have called on ministers to change a law that makes forces widows give up their spouse's pension if they remarry.

item.title: AUDIO: Hislop: Scottish union 'successful'
item.description: Private Eye editor Ian Hislop has praised what he terms the "successful" union between Scotland and the rest of the UK.

item.title: VIDEO: Immigration cap 'is stupid policy'
item.description: Sarah Teather MP on Nick Clegg's leadership, a "stupid policy" on immigration, and "nasty party" coalition colleagues.

item.title: VIDEO: Schools 'not ready for hot meal pledge'
item.description: More than 2,700 schools in England will not be ready to serve hot school meals this September, the BBC finds.

item.title: VIDEO: Devolve power to 'generate jobs we need'
item.description: Ed Miliband offers a "new bargain" to town halls to devolve powers from Whitehall to create jobs.

item.title: VIDEO: Pearce: Everywhere I go, I am noticed
item.description: A woman who found fame after the 2011 London riots says she is still recognised wherever she goes.

item.title: VIDEO: When SpAds go bad, and make the news
item.description: Archive footage reveals how government Special Advisers, known as SpAds, end up in the news for the wrong reasons.

item.title: AUDIO: Former MP criticises sport red tape
item.description: Former Sports Minister, Richard Caborn, says health and safety regulations are making it "difficult" to host sporting events.

item.title: VIDEO: Flint: Not limiting ourselves to 35%
item.description: Labour is not limiting itself to a "35% strategy" for the next general election, says the shadow energy secretary.

item.title: VIDEO: 'Serious questions' for PM over Miller
item.description: Labour leader Ed Miliband has said Prime Minister David Cameron has ''some very serious questions to answer'' in the controversy surrounding Culture Secretary Maria Miller.

item.title: VIDEO: Miller victim of 'media witch hunt'
item.description: Maria Miller has been the victim of a "witch hunt" by newspapers, angry about press regulation in light of the Leveson report, her parliamentary aide has said.

item.title: VIDEO: Miller should quit to 'save honour'
item.description: Culture Secretary Maria Miller should step down "as a question of honour", former Commons Speaker Baroness Boothroyd has said.

item.title: AUDIO: Maria Miller 'hounded' over expenses
item.description: Boris Johnson discusses treatment of Culture Secretary Maria Miller after she overclaimed on her expenses.

item.title: VIDEO: Kinnock-era lessons for Miliband?
item.description: There is talk of "35% strategy" for Labour to win the 2015 general election, but some say it needs new pledges.

item.title: VIDEO: Miller expenses 'damaging' Tory Party
item.description: A Tory MP says the fallout from Maria Miller's expenses is "damaging" both the Conservative Party and the government.

item.title: VIDEO: Nationalists 'monstering' opponents
item.description: Scottish nationalists are "bringing shame" on their country by "shouting down" anyone who speaks out against independence, former Labour chancellor Alistair Darling has said.

item.title: VIDEO: Recalling Pauline Pearce in London riot
item.description: Recalling the summer of 2011 and how footage of Pauline Pearce started her new potential career in politics.

item.title: VIDEO: McGuinness should attend banquet
item.description: The Irish Prime Minister says he is supportive of a decision by Northern Ireland's Deputy First Minister, Martin McGuinness, to attend a banquet hosted by the Queen next week.

item.title: VIDEO: David Cameron hails tax changes
item.description: David Cameron has written to more than a million businesses and charities to urge them to check if they are entitled to a £2,000 National Insurance break.

item.title: VIDEO: PM advisers 'came quite close to menace'
item.description: Tony Gallagher says phone calls from government advisers about Maria Miller "came quite close to menace".

item.title: VIDEO: Clegg commits Lib Dems to devolution
item.description: Nick Clegg commits the Liberal Democrats to including the devolution of new powers to Wales, including policing and youth justice, in their general election manifesto.
